stanza.line: Was it the proud full sail of his great verseverse
Bound for the prize of (all too precious) youyou
That did my ripe thoughts in my brain inhearseinhearse
Making their tomb the womb wherein they grewgrew
Was it his spirit by spirits taught to writewrite
Above a mortal pitch that struck me deaddead
No neither he nor his compeers by nightnight
Giving him aid my verse astonishedastonished
He nor that affable familiar ghostghost
Which nightly gulls him with intelligenceintelligence
As victors of my silence cannot boastboast
I was not sick of any fear from thencethence
But when your countenance filled up his lineline
Then lacked I matter that enfeebled minemine
